description: {"blocks":[{"key":"b585g","text":"Immuno- correlative light and electron microscopy (iCLEM) combines ultrastructural information obtained from high resolution electron microscopy with the use of genetically encoded or cytochemical markers. Immuno-CLEM takes advantage of the antigenicity preserved by Tokuyasu sample preparation to identify, quantify and characterise heterogeneous cell populations in small organisms, organs and tissue of healthy and diseased states. iCLEM can be used in combination with scanning EM (SEM), scanning TEM (STEM), and transmission EM (TEM). These protocols are well-suited, for example, for investigating neural stem and progenitor cell populations of the vertebrate nerve system and are available as separate protocols on protocol.io. Here, a method for iCLEM-TEM is described using an adult zebrafish telencephalon brain as a model. This organ is small in size allowing the complete dorsal telencephalic niche to be visualised in sections, and has diverse cell profiles and regenerative potential of local neural stem and progenitor cells. iCLEM-TEM provides high resolution ultrastructural detail of cells, and consecutive ultrathin (62-70 nm) tissue sections can be examined using different labelling techniques involving the use of immunofluorescent and immunogold markers. steps.section: Tissue fixation
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"7n21b","text":"Dissect out the tissue of interest (example, forebrain of Tg(proliferating cell nuclear antigen:GFP) transgenic adult zebrafish with olfactory bulbs attached for tissue orientation) on a teflon plate or dental wax sheet using fine forceps and a scalpel blade, at room temperature and place in fixative, either 2% paraformaldehyde, 0.2% glutaraldehyde in 0.1M phosphate buffer (PB) (pH 7.4) or 4% paraformaldehyde in 0.1M PB (pH 7.4). Keep the tissue submerged in the fixative at all times.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7gcdh","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7aavf","text":"Always perform fixation using a fume hood and wear appropriate personal protective equipment (PPE). ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Tissue fixation
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"57sj2","text":"Place the tissue in 5 ml tubes containing the fixative used in Step 1 (2% paraformaldehyde, 0.2% glutaraldehyde in 0.1M PB (pH 7.4) or 4% paraformaldehyde in 0.1M PB (pH 7.4)) and fix overnight at 4 degrees Celsius on a rotor. For brain samples, add 4% sucrose to the fixation solution.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Tokuyasu embedding and sectioning
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"eaord","text":"Remove the fixative and wash with phosphate buffered saline (PBS), 3 x 10 mins.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Tokuyasu embedding and sectioning
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"3ed17","text":"Wash with 0.15% glycine in PBS for 10 mins. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":43,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Tokuyasu embedding and sectioning
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"83mc0","text":"Infuse tissue with pre-warmed 6% gelatin in 0.1M PB for 1 hour at 37 degrees Celsius, agitating. Use a heat block to maintain the temperature.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Tokuyasu embedding and sectioning
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"dbj93","text":"Infuse tissue again with pre-warmed 6% gelatin in 0.1M PB for 1 hour at 37 degrees Celsius, agitating.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Tokuyasu embedding and sectioning
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"8mlat","text":"Place gelatin infused tissue in plastic embedding moulds containing pre-warmed 6% gelatin in 0.1M PB at 37 degrees Celsius, and solidify gelatin blocks by cooling at 4 degrees Celsius for 60 mins.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dcaas","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3ks66","text":"Alternatively, the flat embedding method can be used to minimise gelatin block shrinkage following sucrose infiltration. Add 6 percent pre-warmed gelatin in 0.1M PB to a petri dish and solidified at 4 degrees Celsius for 1 hour. Place the tissue on top in a layer of 6 percent gelatin pre-warmed to 37 degrees Celsius. Solidify gelatin at 4 degrees Celsius for 1 hour.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Tokuyasu embedding and sectioning
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"abeg6","text":"Place the gelatin infused tissue blocks on a teflon plate or dental wax sheet and cut off excess gelatin from around the tissue using a razor blade or scalpel. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6n0ac","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bsdtg","text":"For flat embedded samples, cut around the tissue using a razor blade or scalpel and remove the gelatin embedded sample from the petri dish using a small spatula. Cut off excess gelatin using a razor blade or scalpel. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Tokuyasu embedding and sectioning
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"77cct","text":"Fix the gelatin infused tissue blocks in 0.2% paraformaldehyde in 0.1M PB for 30 mins at 4 degrees Celsius, rotating.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Tokuyasu embedding and sectioning
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"cql6g","text":"Wash tissue blocks with 0.1M PB, 3 x 10 mins, agitating.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Tokuyasu embedding and sectioning
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"3e6kv","text":"Infuse tissue blocks with 2.3M sucrose in 0.1M PB for 2 days at 4 degrees Celsius, rotating.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Tokuyasu embedding and sectioning
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"74e1r","text":"Mount each block on a clean aluminium bullseye pin. Position tissue in the correct orientation and remove the excess sucrose with strips of filter paper. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Tokuyasu embedding and sectioning
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"gubf","text":"Freeze each sample block by gently submerging the pins in liquid nitrogen. For large blocks, cool the sample pin in the chamber of a cryo-ultramicrotome (-100 degrees Celsius) for 10 mins prior to freezing in liquid nitrogen. Pins should be mounted and frozen one at a time. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Tokuyasu embedding and sectioning
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"62ekl","text":"Trim the front face and edges of the frozen tissue block cutting 50-100 Î¼m deep on all four sides. Cut at a speed of 100 mm/sec with a 100 nm feed, at -90 to -100 degrees Celsius using a Leica UC7/FC7 cryo-ultramicrotome and Diatome cryotrim 20 knife.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Tokuyasu embedding and sectioning
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"ajc7h","text":"To check the region of interest:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Tokuyasu embedding and sectioning
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"n3j","text":"Once the region of interest has been obtained, cut 62-70 nm ultrathin sections at 0.8 mm/sec and -90 to -100 degrees Celsius using a Leica UC7/FC7 cryo-ultramicrotome and Diatome cryo immuno knife.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Tokuyasu embedding and sectioning
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"78uta","text":"Pick up ultrathin sections in a 1:1 mixture of 2% methylcellulose : 2.3M sucrose in 0.1M PB using a 3 mm stainless steel loop, and place sections on 50-150 mesh copper or palladium coated copper grids with carbon-coated formvar film.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ep1cf","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bce1l","text":"Store grids in an enclosed petri dish at 4 degrees Celsius until use.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Immunofluorescent labelling for optical microscopy using two cellular markers
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"59odc","text":"Use a fine tip pasteur pipette to remove enough PBS from each well so that the lid can be secured on the well-plate without disturbing the floating grids. steps.section: Immunofluorescent labelling for optical microscopy using two cellular markers
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"7m7ad","text":"Put the well-plate containing the grids in an oven set to 50-60 degrees Celsius for 1 hour to remove the 2% methylcellulose : 2.3M sucrose and 6% gelatin from the tissue sections.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Immunofluorescent labelling for optical microscopy using two cellular markers
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"8hg1o","text":"Place a sheet of parafilm on a clean flat bench or a glass board using a small amount of water underneath to keep the film flat. steps.section: Immunofluorescent labelling for optical microscopy using two cellular markers
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"6064r","text":"Quench aldehydes with 0.15% glycine in PBS, 5 x 2 mins.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Immunofluorescent labelling for optical microscopy using two cellular markers
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"71h5c","text":"Block with 1% bovine serum albumin (BSA) in PBS for 5 mins. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Tokuyasu embedding and sectioning
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"ej09d","text":"Consecutive (serial) 62-70 nm tissue sections of the same cell type can be used for the following workflows:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"105pc","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bdpn7","text":"1. Immunofluorescence (IF) labelling of ultrathin sections for optical microscopy using different cellular markers (Steps 20-37) and then preparation of these grids for subsequent TEM imaging to obtain ultrastructural detail (Steps 38-48).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"93kdf","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9pep3","text":"2. Single or double-immunogold labelling of ultrathin sections and TEM imaging to validate the specificity of IF markers at high resolution (Steps 49-77).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bgqfj","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5ru0b","text":"When used in combination, these methods allow for the correlation of two fluorescent markers with two different sized protein-A-gold markers within the same cell, as described below.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4n25f","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Immunogold double-labelling of ultrathin sections for transmission electron microscopy
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"ahgul","text":"Fill the wells of a 24-well plate with PBS and float grids section side down in the solution. Use a fine tip pasteur pipette to remove enough PBS from each well so that the lid can be secured on the well-plate without disturbing the floating grids. Secure the plate lid with parafilm.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Immunogold double-labelling of ultrathin sections for transmission electron microscopy
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"7l54n","text":"Put the plate with the floating grids in an oven set to 50-60 degrees Celsius for 60 minutes to remove the 2% methylcellulose/2.3M sucrose and 6% gelatin from the tissue sections.  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Immunogold double-labelling of ultrathin sections for transmission electron microscopy
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"8570b","text":"Place a sheet of parafilm on the bench using a small amount of water underneath to keep the film flat. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6m93b","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"162o","text":"For the following steps, use a perfect loop or fine forceps to transfer grids from one drop of solution to another, section side down. Use approximately 100-200 Î¼l drops for rinsing and 5 Î¼l drops for antibodies on a clean parafilm surface. Spin all antibodies and protein A-gold (PAG) for 30 seconds using a benchtop microcentrifuge prior to use.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Immunogold double-labelling of ultrathin sections for transmission electron microscopy
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"616bd","text":"Quench aldehydes with 0.15% glycine in PBS, 5 x 2 mins. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Immunogold double-labelling of ultrathin sections for transmission electron microscopy
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"fverf","text":"Block with 1% bovine serum albumin (BSA) in PBS for 5 mins.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Immunogold double-labelling of ultrathin sections for transmission electron microscopy
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"djsnq","text":"Incubate with a primary antibody diluted in 1% BSA/PBS for 45 to 60 minutes in a dark moist chamber at room temperature. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"11re","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"52vds","text":"Example: Mouse anti-glutamine synthetase (1:500 dilution), to label radial glial cells.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Immunogold double-labelling of ultrathin sections for transmission electron microscopy
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"81nij","text":"Rinse with 0.1% BSA in PBS, 5 x 2 mins. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Immunogold double-labelling of ultrathin sections for transmission electron microscopy
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"cb6es","text":"Optionally incubate with a bridging antibody diluted in 1% BSA/PBS for 20 mins, in a dark moist chamber, at room temperature. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"di6cp","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dkl8r","text":"Example: Rabbit anti-mouse Ig bridging antibody (1:1000 dilution). ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Immunogold double-labelling of ultrathin sections for transmission electron microscopy
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"62jl1","text":"Rinse with 0.1% BSA in PBS, 5 x 2 mins. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":33,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Immunogold double-labelling of ultrathin sections for transmission electron microscopy
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"bqkok","text":"Incubate with 10 nm PAG (dilution as recommended by manufacturer for specific batch) diluted in 1% BSA/PBS for 30 mins, in a dark moist chamber, at room temperature. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Immunogold double-labelling of ultrathin sections for transmission electron microscopy
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"esofq","text":"Rinse with 0.1% BSA in PBS, 2 x 2 mins.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Immunogold double-labelling of ultrathin sections for transmission electron microscopy
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"acud9","text":"Rinse with PBS, 5 x 2 mins.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Immunogold double-labelling of ultrathin sections for transmission electron microscopy
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"8ea3o","text":"Fix with 1% glutaraldehyde in PB for 5 mins at room temperature to prevent non-specific binding of subsequent PAG particles and to stabilise the immunogold labelling reaction. This step must be completed in the fume hood using appropriate PPE.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Immunogold double-labelling of ultrathin sections for transmission electron microscopy
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"fb079","text":"Rinse with PBS, 2 x 5 mins.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Immunogold double-labelling of ultrathin sections for transmission electron microscopy
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"at03","text":"Incubate with a primary antibody diluted in 1% BSA/PBS for 45 to 60 mins in a dark moist chamber, at room temperature. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"69jl2","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1klvk","text":"Example: Biotinylated enhanced green fluorescent protein (eGFP) (1:500 dilution).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Immunogold double-labelling of ultrathin sections for transmission electron microscopy
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"9ioml","text":"Rinse with 0.1% BSA in PBS, 5 x 2 mins. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Immunogold double-labelling of ultrathin sections for transmission electron microscopy
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"aa882","text":"Optionally incubate with a bridging antibody (1:10,000 dilution) diluted in 1% BSA/PBS for 30 mins in a dark moist chamber at room temperature. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3to9e","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"f98vo","text":"Example: Rabbit anti-biotin bridging antibody (1:10,000 dilution)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Immunogold double-labelling of ultrathin sections for transmission electron microscopy
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"572bc","text":"Rinse with 0.1% BSA in PBS, 5 x 2 mins. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"4dk4g","text":"Incubate with 20 nm PAG (dilution as recommended by manufacturer for specific batch) diluted in 1% BSA/PBS for 30 mins in a dark moist chamber, at room temperature. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Immunogold double-labelling of ultrathin sections for transmission electron microscopy
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"9bo82","text":"Rinse with 0.1% BSA in PBS, 2 x 2 mins. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Immunogold double-labelling of ultrathin sections for transmission electron microscopy
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"36cfk","text":"Rinse with PBS, 5 x 2 mins.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Immunogold double-labelling of ultrathin sections for transmission electron microscopy
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"f62v","text":"Fix in 1% glutaraldehyde in PB for 5 mins at room temperature to stabilise the immunogold-labelling reaction. This step must be completed in the fume hood using appropriate PPE.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Immunogold double-labelling of ultrathin sections for transmission electron microscopy
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"caidr","text":"Rinse with PBS, 2 x 5 mins. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Immunogold double-labelling of ultrathin sections for transmission electron microscopy
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"9p753","text":"Rinse with distilled water, 6 x 1 min.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Immunogold double-labelling of ultrathin sections for transmission electron microscopy
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"6c5il","text":"Stain the grid in a drop of 2% Uranyloxalate (pH 7.0) for 5 mins at room temperature.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Immunogold double-labelling of ultrathin sections for transmission electron microscopy
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"f84nf","text":"Cover a glass petri dish with parafilm using a small amount of water under the film to keep it flat. Place the dish on ice and add 3 drops of 2% methylcellulose : 4% uranyl acetate (9 ml : 1 ml) (pH 4.0) to the surface. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Immunogold double-labelling of ultrathin sections for transmission electron microscopy
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"cb417","text":"Float the grid briefly in the first two drops of methylcellulose/uranyl acetate (pH 4.0), then transfer to the third drop and leave for 10 mins.  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Immunogold double-labelling of ultrathin sections for transmission electron microscopy
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"5j1cl","text":"Remove and dry the grid by the looping out method, described above (Step 47).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
